# alicloud\_chatbot\_agents

This data source provides the Chatbot Agents of the current Alibaba Cloud user.

-> **NOTE:** Available in v1.203.0+.

## Example Usage

```typescript
import * as constructs from "constructs";
import * as cdktf from "cdktf";
/*Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.*/
import * as alicloud from "./.gen/providers/alicloud";
class MyConvertedCode extends cdktf.TerraformStack {
  constructor(scope: constructs.Construct, name: string) {
    super(scope, name);
    const dataAlicloudChatbotAgentsNameRegex =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudChatbotAgents.DataAlicloudChatbotAgents(
        this,
        "nameRegex",
        {
          nameRegex: "^my-Agent",
        }
      );
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "alicloud_chatbot_agents_id_1", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(dataAlicloudChatbotAgentsNameRegex.agents, [
        "0",
        "id",
      ]),
    });
  }
}

```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `outputFile` - (Optional) File name where to save data source results (after running `terraform plan`).
* `agentName` - (Optional,ForceNew) The name of the agent.
* `nameRegex` - (Optional,ForceNew) A regex string to filter resulting chatbot agents by name.
* `ids` - (Optional,ForceNew,Computed) A list of chatbot agents IDs.

## Attributes Reference

The following attributes are exported in addition to the arguments listed above:

* `names` - A list of chatbot agents names.
* `agents` - A list of availability zones. Each element contains the following attributes:
  * `id` - ID of the agent.
  * `agentId` - The agent id.
  * `agentKey` - Service space signature, which is used when PAAS interface specifies the service space.
  * `agentName` - The agent Name.
